defs: (correctly, ಏರುಹಾಕು) to make heap of; to throw or lay in a heap.
(correctly, ಏರುಹೊತ್ತು) the period between sunrise and the noon (when the sun seems to keep rising).
a climbing up, as mounting on the back of a horse, elephant etc.
a falling of one upon the other, as in a physical combat.
an act of competing, vying to excel.
= ಏರಾಟ.
to climb up; to mount on.
to fight physically.
to compete; to vie.
a long heap of earth, made for or serving as an obstructing barrier against flow of water, 2) a naturally elevated ground.
a man-made pool, lake or cistern for storing water; a tank.
(dial.) a small channel for irrigation.
a fresh water fish, Wallago attu, which grows upto six feet.
to make a long heap of earth, as a barrier, to hold back or regulate the flow of water.
the act or an instance of going up; an escalating; a rise; a soar; an increase.
higher rank, position, esteem; marked excellence in quality; eminence.
to beat, pound heavily; to strike with heavy blows.
to beat to pulp or powder; to pound; to pulverise.
a long tract of land, along a canal, reserved for making a mound on.
the plant Tridax procumbens of Asteraeae family.
to raise to a higher place; to lift up; to elevate; to hoist.
to set or cause to wear (flowers etc. in the hair).
to string a blow.
to cause to rise or soar; to raise; to elevate; to hoist.
to cause to grow higher or taller.
to place on or upon; to super-impose.
to heap up the earth, as to make a mound.
(pl.) a going up and coming or falling down; a rise and a fall.
(pl.) the regular increase and decrease in the levels of the surface of oceans, seas etc. caused by the attraction of the moon and sun.
(pl.) the recurrence of fortune and misfortune in one's life; good and bad periods; prosperity and down fall; ups and downs; growing stronger and weaker.
the naturally elevated and inclined ground.
acclivity and declivity.
to go to a higher level, position or place; to rise; to ascend; to mount; to climb up.
to advance in social status, rank, importance.
(ground, mountain etc.) to have an upward incline or slant.
(price, cost, value, etc.) to become more, to go up; to soar.

ಏರಗತ್ತು ēragattu raised voice; ಏರಸಲ್ಲು ērasallu to come to one's notice; to be observed; ಏರಿಬರು ēribaru to fall upon; to attack; ಏರಿಕೊಳ್ ērikoḷ to climb up; to mount on; ಏರಿಹೋಗು ērihōgu to march against; to attack; ಏರುಹಾಕಿಕೊಡು ēruākikoḍu to support one (opposing another); ಏರಿದವ ಇಳಿದಾನು ēridava iḷidānu (prov.) good days may not last forever; every tide hath its web.
the act of going, climbing or mounting up; a rise; soar.
an ascending slope (of ground, a hill, etc.); elevation; acclivity.
a plough yoked on to a pair of oxen.
an injury to the body (as from violence, accident or surgery) that involves laceration or breaking of a membrane (as the skin) and usually damage to underlying tissues; a wound.
ಏರಬಾಯಿ ērabāyi opening of a wound; the wound that is not healed.
(dial.) a quantity of two bagful of grains, used as a unit of measurement of quantity.
to pile up; to make a heap.
to pile up; to make a heap.

a climbing plant or vine.

ಎದ್ದಾಡು eddāḍu to jump (in joy); ಎದ್ದಾಸರು eddāsaru intense desire or need for water caused by dryness in the mouth and throat; ಎದ್ದಾಳು eddāḷu a tall person; 2. a person of importance, good social status; 3. a person who is conspicuous in a gathering by some particular or peculiar physical characteristics, ಎದ್ದುಕಾಣಿಸು eddu kāṇisu to be projecting out (as from with a plain surface); 2. to be attracting attention by being unusual, outstanding; to be striking, prominent or conspicuous; ಎದ್ದುಕಾಣು eddu kāṇu = ಎದ್ದುಕಾಣಿಸು; ಎದ್ದರೆ ಜುಟ್ಟು ಹಿಡಿ, ಬಿದ್ದರೆ ಕಾಲು ಹಿಡಿ eddare juṭṭu hiḍi, biddare kālu hiḍi (prov.) to have dual value systems; to be arrogant while in a favourable position, but to be humble when humiliated; ಏಳು ಅನ್ನೋ ಜಾಗದಲ್ಲಿ ಕೂಡಬಾರದು ēḷu annō jāgadalli kūrbāradu (prov.) stay not where you do not get respect.
the act or an instance of going up; a rise.

totalling one more than six; seven.
the cardinal number seven; 7.

ಏಳುಹನ್ನೊಂದಾಗು ēḷuhannondāgu (ruin, ravage, loss, etc.) to happen; 2. to become very difficult; ಏಳರಾಟ Eḷarāṭa (astrol.) the agonising period of seven and half years caused by the planet Saturn being in an unfavourable position; ಏಳೆರಡು1 ēḷerḍu amounting to fourteen; ಏಳೆರಡು2 ēḷerḍu the cardinal number fourteen; 14; ಏಳುಕೆರೆಯ ನೀರುಕುಡಿ ēḷukereya nīru kuḍi (fig.) to go from town to town in pursuit of one's livelihood; to struggle hard; 2. (fig.) to get the real experience of hard life; ಏಳುಕೆರೆಯ ನೀರುಕುಡಿಸು ēḷu kereya nīrukuḍisu to make another's life miserable; to trouble; to annoy; ಏಳನೇ ತಿಂಗಳಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಹುಟ್ಟಿರು ēḷanē tiŋgaḷinalli huṭṭiru (fig .) to hasten always with little thought (as an inborn quality of one's personality).
